page.title: 04Adult Education in Trefriw
page.content: The Workers' Educational Association holds a weekly evening class during the winter months on a chosen subject, such as local history or wild life.The classes are in the Welsh language. Evening classes for learners of the Welsh language are also held in the school during the winter months. Welsh and mathematics are the only subjects still subsidised by Gwynedd in these days of financial stringency. A library is listed in the count of Trefriw facilities, but this is a mobile service,once a month,and should not imply a permanent building in the village.
